description.value:
The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 4d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained]{restrained} and has disadvantage on &Reference[str]{Strength} checks and &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The roper pulls each creature &Reference[grappled]{grappled} by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

False Appearance. While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Grasping Tendrils. The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to &Reference[poison]{poison} and &Reference[psychic]{psychic} damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 &Reference[str]{Strength} check against it.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Spider Climb. The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
